channel.title: Comments on: My Current Two Principles Of Software Development
channel.description: Amit Schreiber's Blog | הבלוג של עמית שרייבר

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description:
Off the top of my mind: function sizes (keep them small), global variables (don't have many), access to members (do not allow).
There are so many, but most of them do not apply for all programming styles/fields (for example, in embedded programming global variables are more common). In this sense, DRY is unique - it applies for every programming style I know.
item.content:encoded:
Off the top of my mind: function sizes (keep them small), global variables (don’t have many), access to members (do not allow).

There are so many, but most of them do not apply for all programming styles/fields (for example, in embedded programming global variables are more common). In this sense, DRY is unique – it applies for every programming style I know.

item.title: By: rom
item.dc:creator: rom
item.description: What are the other principles, besides DRY?
item.content:encoded: What are the other principles, besides DRY?
